history.content: You just need a 3.3 tech GPA and 1 EECS course per semester you've been enrolled in Berkeley iirc

@976 and @2618

Your ESS advisor should be able to tell you the specific requirements. COE has chosen not to display this on their website, but is OK with us posting here. Where was there wrong information posted?

You can use E7 (though CS61A is recommended), but it doesn't count toward your progress to change majors.

Please read through below and let us know what questions you still have.

 

Electrical Engineering & Computer Science 
Will automatically accept students who meet criteria (1) and (2)
(1) GPA of 3.3 or better in all technical course work completed to date (includes math and basic sciences in addition to engineering) and who have a minimum 3.3 in EECS courses (see list below). 


(2) Making satisfactory progress towards core classes for the major, defined as follows 

Students who have completed N semesters, for N = 1, 2, 3, or 4, must have completed at least N of EE 20, EE 40, EE 16A, EE 16B, CS61A, CS61B, CS61C, CS 70.

 

Students who have completed N semesters, for N = 5 or greater, must have completed all of EE 20 or EE 16A, EE 40 or EE 16B, CS61A, CS61B, and CS61C and must have completed at least N-4 upper division courses in EECS.

 

E 7 cannot be used toward the above.  It can be substituted once admitted for CS 61A (though not at all advised for students interested in Computer Science), but can’t be used to meet minimum eligibility requirements. 

(3) Students with less than a 3.3 in technical courses are not eligible. 

 

(4) Must apply by no later than the end of the junior year, including adding as a second major.

children.subject:
I still had a question regarding the number of semesters required in order for a change of major to EECS. I have emailed an EECS advisor and they told me a minimum of two semesters. However, it looks like I can change my major following my first semester after taking EE 16A since it states N = 1, assuming I meet the other GPA requirements? 

"Students who have completed N semesters, for N = 1, 2, 3, or 4, must have completed at least N of EE 20, EE 40, EE 16A, EE 16B, CS61A, CS61B, CS61C, CS 70."

Thanks!

Major Switch from within CoE
What are the required classes needed to switch to an EECS major coming from another major within CoE? When must these classes be completed by?

history.content:
What are the requirements for switching to EECS from another engineering major? The EECS / Engineering websites do a very poor job of illustrating the correct information as far as I can tell. As I understand, the requirements are a 3.3 technical gpa, one EE/CS course taken for every semester at berkeley, at least 2 semesters of attendance. Is this all? I am also under the impression that I can substitute in E7 for CS61A if I was already declared as another major. Where on the internet can I find the actual information about changing majors? My academic advisor told me some of the information I was looking at was not correct. 

Also, suppose I was previously declared as an MSE major, and I took E 45. Does this count towards my technical gpa and also will it fulfill the 45 credits of engineering courses I am required to take?

Currently, I have only taken 61b and E7, which means I don't meet the one course for every semester here requirement. I'm planning on taking cs70 and 16A next semester to meet this. Since the information online says nothing about this one course per semester requirement, and also that E7 can be subbed for 61A, would it be possible for me to declare this semester, or will I have to wait until after next semester, provided I meet the other requirements at this time?

Thanks!
history.subject: Questions About Switching to EECS from Another Engineering Major
